name: Goat Milk Moisturizing Cleanser
about: What it is: Gentle, non-foaming, creamy daily cleanser that is clinically formulated with goat milk to cleanse and soothe without tightness or irritation...Skin Type: Normal, Dry, Combination, and Oily..Skincare Concerns: Dryness, Dullness and uneven texture..Formulation:  Cream..Highlighted Ingredients:.- Goat Milk: Soothes dry, sensitive skin with natural milk proteins..- Jojoba & Avocado Oil: Moisturizes and conditions skin..- Manuka Honey: Nourishes skin without irritation...Ingredient Callouts: Free of sulfates SLS and SLES, parabens, and phthalates, and features recyclable packaging. It is clinically tested safe for sensitive skin...What Else You Need to Know: Inspired by the relief our founder, Kate, experienced as a child when goatu2019s milk helped alleviate her painful eczema. This lightweight cleanser is a skincare staple for dry, parched skin...Kate Somerville has been certified cruelty-free by PETA, solidifying the brandu2019s commitment to never test their products or ingredients on animals.
ingredients: -Goat Milk: Soothes dry, sensitive skin with natural milk proteins..-Manuka Honey: Nurtures skin without any tightness, dryness, or irritation. ..Water Sodium Cocoyl Isethionate, Cocamidopropyl Hydroxysultaine, Glycerin, Polyglyceryl-3 Methylglucose Distearate, Betaine, Glyceryl Distearate, Vitis Vinifera (Grape) Seed Oil, Simmondsia Chinensis (Jojoba) Seed Oil, Persea Gratissima (Avocado) Oil, Cocos Nucifera (Coconut) Oil, Caprylic/Capric Triglyceride, Xylitylglucoside, Propanediol, Polyacrylate Crosspolymer-6, Glyceryl Stearate, Cetearyl Alcohol, Caprae Lac (Goat Milk, Lait de Chu00e8vre), Lactose, Milk Protein, Lactic Acid, Tocopherol, Mel Extract (Honey Extract, Extrait de Miel), Rosmarinus Officinalis (Rosemary) Leaf Extract, Helianthus Annuus (Sunflower) Extract, Bisabolol, Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Juice, Sodium Lauroyl Glutamate, Oryza Sativa (Rice) Bran Extract, Xylitol, 1,2-Hexanediol, Anhydroxylitol, Parfum/Fragrance, Stearic Acid, Disodium EDTA, Caprylhydroxamic Acid, Xanthan Gum, t-butyl Alcohol, Benzyl Salicylate.
how_to_use: Suggested Usage:.-AM or PM. Use twice a day..-Apply a small amount to wet face and massage gently for 30 seconds..-Rinse well and gently pat dry.

reviews.review_title: Almost perfect gentle cleanser - strong fragrance.
reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, brown hair, Fair skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: My skin type is combination/ very sensitive with eczema and is often dry due to retinoid use. I was looking for a calming, soothing rich cleanser to use when my skin is stressed or dry. It has a lovely creamy texture that lathers without stripping and leaves my skin hydrated and residue free (I use it as my second cleanser step at night after an oil cleanse to remove sunblock and makeup), or on its own for a gentle morning cleanse. However, the one star off is for the fragrance: fragrance is stronger than I expected (I did notice fragrance at the end of the ingredients list but most KS products Iu2019ve used have had minimal or no fragrance and most reviews indicated it was mild). The fragrance is very beachy and tropical - kind of a coconut vanilla that smells like cheap sunblock. Itu2019s definitely noticeable and unfortunately happens to be a type of fragrance I really dislike.  Been using for about a week and my sensitive skin doesnu2019t love the fragrance. Giving it a few more days to adjust and if it doesnu2019t then I may have to return.  I would be extremely interested in a fragrance free option (would have received 5 stars except for fragrance) because besides the scent itu2019s exactly what Iu2019m looking for as my skin gets more mature and dry. If youu2019re not sensitive to fragrance and you like the smell of fruity coconut sunblock this is an excellent gentle hydrating option. If youu2019re sensitive to fragrance or dislike vanilla/coconut type bath and body works smells give this one a pass or try a sample first.

Then I received some great advice. When your skin is like that you have to protect the moisture barrier and add moisture and use soothing products. reviews.review_title: A Must Have for Dry, Sensitive Skin
reviews.review_buyer_description: Dry skin
reviews.review_text: Iu2019ve been on the lookout for a good cleanser that wonu2019t entirely strip out my natural oils, and leave me with this super tight feeling. I have tried popular cleansers that people would rave about but it was no match for my dry skin. It would always leave me with this squeaky,tight clean feeling. Sometimes it would leave me with flaky skin due to its strong cleansing agents. I purchased the Goat Milk cleanser hoping that it would repair my skin barrier. On the first use I was surprised at how supple it left my skin. It has this nice velvety texture that leaves the skin moisturized and hydrated. No tight skin feeling. No flaky skin. Just clean and moisturized skin. Most importantly it does not leave any redness on my skin! I have extremely sensitive skin which makes it hard to find a good cleanser that wonu2019t irritate my skin. Once I switched to this cleanser I started to notice the redness disappear from my previous cleanser. I highly recommend this product if you suffer from very dry, sensitive skin! Itu2019s worth every dollar!

I expected it to leave behind a waxy sort of feeling that many hydrating cleansers have (think of Cerave hydrating cleanser). BUT as I massaged it into my skin, it emulsified beautifully! It was able to remove my Drunk Elephant cleansing balm, which is very thick, and it rinsed off super nicely. It created a super nice lather that was the perfect consistency. My skin had a glow to it and I felt zero tightness. More importantly, it didnu2019t leave behind any film or residue. Iu2019m in love! reviews.review_text: My skin tends to be quite sensitive, often getting red and feeling uncomfortably tight after using other cleaners.  In the past, I have had trouble with tightness and irritation even with products specifically marketed for sensitive skin!  I have been using the Kate Somerville Goat Milk Moisturizing Cleanser for about two months now and found the product to live up to the claims of soothing sensitive skin and cleansing without tightness, dryness, or irritation.  As mentioned in the instructions, a small amount is enough to do the job (I'd say a bit larger than pea-sized) so the 4 oz. tube actually lasts quite a while even with twice daily use. This will be a definite repurchase for me!   I do find the that this cleanser alone does not remove all my eye makeup, but that is not a problem for me.  Although I wear makeup almost daily, I prefer to remove my makeup with an oil-based product and then cleanse my face before moving on to the rest of my skincare routine.    I did notice that the ingredients list did include Cocos Nucifera (Coconut) Oil and Parfum/Fragrance, which I mention since they may be of concern for some users.  I personally have not experienced any additional breakouts - a possible concern with coconut oil. Despite the fragrance listing, I have not experienced any irritation or noticed a strong smell to the product.  I would say overall that the smell is fairly neutral.

I had frequent visits to the dermatologist and was prescribed everything under the sun but nothing worked. I did a lot of research and decided to give Kate  Somerville products a shot and Iu2019ll never go back. I use this cleanser twice a day and honestly look forward to it. reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, blonde hair, Fair skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: tl;dr version - this cleanser feels exquisite while using, and finds the impossible balance between actually cleaning your skin, but not leaving it dry and stripped. The significant scent of vanilla is ( to me ) non-irritating and pleasant, but might put off some people.   Iu2019m pickier about cleansers than anything else in my entire beauty routine. My skin reacts to too-drying cleansers by overproducing oil and making me break out. On the other hand, while many oil and milky cleansers make my skin feel good, the lack of a deeper clean leaves my skin looking dull. This feels like a miracle. It emulsifies, not foams, on application, and feels so nurturing to the skin. After rinsing off, my skin feels clean and soft. Compared to other milk cleansers, this feels less greasy and more cleaning. The whole process is so enjoyable, I really look forward to doing my skincare routine.    Many scents give me a headache, allergic reactions, or skin inflammation. This is the rare instance of a scent that really improves the skincare experience. It smells sweet and light, and doesnu2019t trigger any sensitives for me.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, auburn hair, Fair skin tone, Dry skin
